page.title: 15The Band ,Kingsbury.
page.content: There has been a band in Kingsbury for over 100 years.At present there are 43 members,ranging from 10 to 77 years old.The uniform is black with red and gold trim.The band plays at church and school fetes,carnivals,concerts and some church services.This involves the members in travel over a wide area of Somerset and Dorset.One whole day trip was to the Harvest Home in Brent.We went to talk to a local man who has been in the band since 1945.He plays the tuba.He explained how he looks after his instrument by polishing it and washing it out regularly with boiling water.Although it is heavy he tries hard not to drop it,as a dent affects the quality of sound.Band practice is held in the church hall one night a week in summer,two in winter.His wife says he has to be really poorly not to attend.
